Dorsey, who had long been seen as Buffalo’s heir apparent to now-former offensive coordinator Brian Daboll, was officially handed the job after Daboll left to become the new head coach of the New York Giants.
He became a top target for Allen late in the season and into the playoffs, culminating with his record-setting performance in the divisional round loss to the Kansas City Chiefs.
The Bills wide receiver appeared on the Richard Sherman Podcast this week, saying he’s excited to have Dorsey taking over the continuity it will bring to the offense.
Brady was highly coveted, with ESPN’s Adam Schefter reporting shortly after he parted ways with the Panthers that several teams were interested in interviewing him.
The move has been especially popular with Bills players, with a wide receiver coming out of a career breakout performance sharing some love for Dorsey.
